intro: Alafia klaineana, commonly known as the Hawaiian alafia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, particularly Hawaii. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Alafia klaineana is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and along stream banks.
